    Release notes

    Stay updated with the latest product features, enhancements, and fixes.

    To get the latest product updates delivered to you in an RSS feed, add the URL of this page to your feed reader, or add the feed URL directly: RSS Feed.

    Filter by
    ▾

    October 2025

    Administration

    Updates and fixes

    • Updated the AI Assistant feature to include two new functions:
      • Latest Profile Version Summary: Provides a summary of configuration changes made to the profile in the latest published version. Works for both client-side and server-side profiles.
      • Find an Attribute: Assists in locating server-side attributes based on natural language searches. For example, to find any attributes that use rolling sum enrichments or any attributes referenced by badges.
    October 8, 2025
    Server-side connectors
    Advance notices

    ⏰ We’re sharing advance notice of upcoming changes so you have time to review, prepare, and update your systems. In general, you can expect changes listed here to be released in 2-4 weeks.

    Server-side connectors

    • Microsoft UET Conversion API: Universal Event Tracking (UET) is a Microsoft framework which captures user engagement data on your website, enabling features like conversion tracking (such as purchases or leads), audience targeting (such as Remarketing), auto bidding and Microsoft Bing for Commerce. The UET Conversion API can be used independently or alongside UET JS tracking.
    • Nextdoor Conversion connector: An upcoming update will simplify setup, reduce required fields, and expand support for customer identifiers to better align with Nextdoor’s API.
    October 8, 2025
    iQ Tag Management
    Client-side administration

    Updates and fixes

    • Updated the publish comparison view to accurately reflect only the actual differences between the selected environment and the current profile version. Previously, unchanged items were incorrectly listed as updated.

    Connectors

    Updates and fixes

    October 8, 2025
    Server-side
    Moments API

    New stuff

    We are excited to introduce the Tealium Moments API MCP Server, enabling secure, real-time access to visitor profile data for AI-driven personalization, analytics, and automation. This server allows AI systems to query visitor attributes, badges, and audiences using the Model Context Protocol (MCP), delivering instant insights tailored to specific use cases.

    October 8, 2025
    iQ Tag Management
    Moments iQ

    Updates and fixes

    • Fixed an issue in the latest version of Moments iQ where embedded modals failed to display correctly.
    • Fixed an issue in the Moments iQ tag where using line breaks in header, main, or question text fields caused the tag template to break after publishing. Line breaks and carriage returns are now safely removed to prevent template errors.

    September 2025

    Product highlights

    Tealium Product Highlights (September 2025)

    🔥 What’s new

    New connectors

    • New Relic
    • Singular
    • Splunk
    • The Trade Desk CRM

    NoteGen Agent
    NoteGen Agent is an AI feature that uses AI to translate complex Tealium use case configurations into easy-to-understand descriptions, making it easier for you to build context and seamlessly jump into your work. This reduces the cognitive load of trying to understand what was previously done, enabling faster onboarding, better collaboration, and efficient troubleshooting.

    With a single click, generate clear and context-rich notes for configuration artifacts. Starting with Tealium iQ variables, NoteGen will soon provide support for other configuration elements such as audiences, attributes, functions, extensions, and more!

    Potential audience size
    Potential audience size shows how many visitor profiles—out of the total number of visitors—match your criteria in the audience creation and edit workflows. This helps you refine targeting and gain confidence in your audience conditions with a super quick calculation.

    ⏳ Coming soon to GA

    Profile version summary (AI Assistant)
    The profile version summary in AI Assistant provides instant, single-click visibility into recent Tealium configuration changes. This keeps users fully informed about their latest profile publishes, allowing them to maintain control, improve transparency, and quickly respond if adjustments or revisions are needed.

    New AudienceStream attributes experience
    The AudienceStream attributes table has a cleaner, more organized experience, letting you quickly access details and take bulk actions like assigning labels or deleting attributes. Plus, a new screen provides a clear summary of where each attribute is used, helping you manage dependencies with ease.

    🔬 Early Access

    New navigation menu
    Opt in to the new navigation menu experience and switch back anytime. The new navigation menu is organized by actions and common jobs across different user roles.

    Google BigQuery and Databricks Data Cloud Inbound (sign up required*)
    Import bulk data from Google BigQuery or Databricks tables or views at near real-time speeds or at a scheduled time. After you import your data, transform and map it to Tealium attributes and build better audiences for targeted activation. Combine data storage with real-time data for cross-system connectivity to enable real-time, agile, consented data streams.

    *Early Access sign ups: If you are interested in trying this feature, contact your Tealium Support representative.

    September 30, 2025
    Platforms
    Tealium for iOS (Swift)

    Version 2.18.1

    Low Impact Changes

    • Fixed Tealium initialization completion block not clearing after being used.
    • Fixed DeviceData module to set UIDevice.current.isBatteryMonitoringEnabled only once during module initialization on the main thread, ensuring thread safety and preventing potential crashes.
    • Added two new TealiumConfig options: batteryReportingEnabled and screenReportingEnabled. Customers that don’t need battery or screen information can disable their collection by setting false. The default value is true.
    September 26, 2025
    Platforms
    Tealium for Magento

    Version 4.1

    • Updated for PHP 8.4 compatibility.
    • Fixes for RequireJS and asset paths.
    • Updates for Magento coding standard compliance.
    • Miscellaneous bug fixes and improvements.
    September 25, 2025
    Client-side tags

    Updates and fixes

    • Fixed an issue in the Piano Analytics tag where initial events could be sent before setConfigurations, resulting in hostless requests and ERR_NAME_NOT_RESOLVED. The tag now queues configuration first and normalizes the collection domain and path to ensure all events route to the configured CDDC. You must update the tag template to apply this fix.

    Server-side
    Audiences

    New stuff

    • Potential audience size provides an estimate of the number of visitors that meet the audience or segment conditions which lets you quickly estimate the size of audiences for activation. Knowing the impact of the potential audience reveals high-impact marketing opportunities in real-time and lets you make informed decisions with data-backed confidence.
    September 23, 2025
    Platforms
    Advance notices

    ⏰ We’re sharing advance notice of upcoming changes so you have time to review, prepare, and update your systems. In general, you can expect changes listed here to be released in 2-4 weeks.

    utag.js 4.54

    • utag.js version 4.54 will introduce a new disable_tealium_attribute_override setting and fix an issue with how tealium_visitor_id is handled in payloads.

      In versions 4.52 and 4.53, override protection for system-defined tealium_* attributes was enabled by default, which caused issues in some mobile webviews. In 4.54, this behavior will be opt-in. Set disable_tealium_attribute_override to true to prevent incoming values from overriding system-defined attributes.

    • New Relic
    • Splunk

    Updates and fixes

    • Fixed an issue in the Snapchat Conversions connector where the event_tag field was incorrectly mapped at the top level of the payload. It is now placed correctly under custom_data.event_tag, according to Snapchat API requirements.
    • Updated the Google SA360 Enhanced Conversions connector to convert mapped Tealium date attributes from milliseconds to microseconds, as required by Google.

    Client-side tags

    • Piano Analytics tag: An upcoming update will fix an issue where events could be sent before setConfigurations, resulting in hostless requests and ERR_NAME_NOT_RESOLVED errors. The update will queue configuration first and normalize the collection domain and path to ensure events are sent to the correct CDDC. A tag update will be required to apply this fix.
    September 10, 2025
    API

    New stuff

    • The Tealium Collect HTTP API v3 is now available. Use this endpoint for secure authenticated data collection.
    September 10, 2025
    Client-side tags

    Updates and fixes

    • Fixed an issue in the Facebook Pixel tag where the helper library caused “Mismatched anonymous define() module” errors on RequireJS sites, preventing page rendering. The tag now uses a RequireJS-compatible registration method to ensure smooth operation in single-page applications. You must update the tag template to apply this fix.
    • Updated the Adobe Target tag to use Target library version 2.11.8 and added mappings for aepSandboxId and aepSandboxName. You must update the tag template for the new mappings to take effect.
    • Updated the Amplitude Browser SDK tag to support session replay, and guides and surveys.
    September 10, 2025
    Server-side connectors

    Updates and fixes

    • Fixed an issue in the Snapchat Conversions connector where batched events were sent using a single pixel ID, even when different pixel IDs were mapped per event.
    September 10, 2025

    Updates and fixes

    • Removed the Audience Stream Capable filter and category from the tag marketplace to improve clarity.
    • Updated the Tags page filter menu to improve accuracy and usability. Fixed the Tealium Tags filter to display correct results and removed outdated filter options for a cleaner UI.
    • Resolved an issue where updating a tag template through the template status checker failed due to a missing tag_id parameter.

    ⏰ We’re sharing advance notice of upcoming changes so you have time to review, prepare, and update your systems. In general, you can expect changes listed here to be released in 2-4 weeks.

    Server-side connectors
    Advance notices

    ⏰ We’re sharing advance notice of upcoming changes so you have time to review, prepare, and update your systems. In general, you can expect changes listed here to be released in 2-4 weeks.

    Server-side connectors

    • Facebook Conversions Connector: We are adding support for automatic mapping of Tealium e-commerce variables to Facebook conversion parameters. You can disable automapping in the connector settings or map different attributes to these parameters to override this behavior. The following e-commerce mappings are applied automatically:
      • _csubtotal to value
      • _ccurrency to currency
      • _cprod (array) to contents[].id
      • _csku (array) to contents[].item_number
      • _cquan (array) to contents[].quantity
      • _corder to order_id
      • _ccat (array) to contents[].category
      • _cprodname (array) to contents[].name
      • _cprice (array) to contents[].item_price
    August 6, 2025
    Client-side tags

    Updates and fixes

    • Fixed an issue in the Microsoft UET tag where u.initialized was set too early, causing bat.js to never load and uetq.push() calls to fail. Initialization now occurs after the loader executes, ensuring proper event queuing and tracking. You must update the tag template to get this fix.

    July 30, 2025
    Product highlights

    Tealium Product Highlights (July 2025)

    🔥 What’s new

    New connectors

    • Databricks
    • CDK CRM

    Moments iQ Enhancements
    We’ve made Moments iQ easier and faster to use. Enjoy streamlined tabs, flexible placement, a new styling matrix, and simpler answer setup that gives you more control over building experiences.

    • Organized tabs: General settings, form options, and styling controls now appear in their own dedicated screens to keep the configuration tidy and easy to navigate.
    • Styling matrix view: See and manage up to 30 style configurations at a glance. No more scrolling and searching the configuration list.
    • Flexible placement: Choose exactly where your experience lives: top left, bottom right, center screen, or embedded – it’s your call.
    • Add answers with ease: No more pipe-separated lists. Just add new answers line by line for a cleaner, simpler setup.
    • Conditional redirects: Set unique redirects per answer or a single fallback redirect - no JavaScript extensions needed.
    • New styling options: A handful of fresh styling options to keep your experiences on brand and looking sharp.

    Databricks outbound connector
    The Databricks connector empowers businesses to unify and activate their customer data with speed and intelligence. By seamlessly connecting Tealium’s real-time Customer Data Platform (CDP) with Databricks’ advanced AI and analytics capabilities, organizations can enrich customer profiles, enhance predictive modeling, and drive smarter, data-driven decisions.

    🔬 Early Access

    Databricks Data Cloud Inbound
    Import bulk data from Databricks tables or views at near real-time speeds or at a scheduled time. After you import your data, transform and map it to Tealium attributes and build better audiences for targeted activation. Combine data storage with real-time data for cross-system connectivity to enable real-time, agile, consented data streams.

    Audience sizing (sign up required*)
    Potential audience size shows how many visitor profiles—out of the total number of visitors—match your criteria in the audience creation and edit workflows. This helps you refine targeting and gain confidence in your audience conditions with a super quick calculation.

    New AudienceStream attributes experience (sign up required*)
    The AudienceStream attributes table has a cleaner, more organized experience, allowing you to quickly access details and take bulk actions like assigning labels or deleting attributes. Plus, a new screen provides a clear summary of where each attribute is used, helping you manage dependencies with ease.

    *Early Access sign ups: If you are interested in trying this feature, contact your Tealium Support representative.

    June 2025

    Product highlights

    Tealium Product Highlights (June 2025)

    🔥 What’s new

    New connectors

    • Adition PostTracking
    • Amazon Ads Data Manager
    • Microsoft Fabric Eventhouse
    • Roku Events API

    Functions Insights Dashboard
    The new Functions Insights Dashboard provides all relevant information about your functions, their executions, errors and more in a single place. Similar to Connectors Dashboard, this is the perfect overview of all your functions usage.

    Improved Hashing and Encryption library for functions
    The high performance tealium/crypto library for functions is a Java-native replacement of the existing crypto-es.js. It allows faster execution of functions (up to 30% performance boost), enables more transformations within the same time, and provides a better real-time pipeline experience in all scenarios where hashing or encryption of attributes matters.

    CookieConsent & Tealium iQ
    CookieConsent is a flexible, open source consent management tool integrated with Tealium iQ and hosted on the Tealium CDN. It works with Tealium enforcement tools and integrations to support enterprise-scale deployments, A/B testing, improved accessibility, and a block-by-default framework. CookieConsent ensures accurate server-side tracking, including the ability to refire Collect events upon the initial consent decision and trigger additional server-side actions without duplication or data loss.

    New Connectors Experience
    The new connectors experience delivers streamlined workflows, improved connector metrics, enhanced error tracking, and upgraded usability such as the ability to copy mappings and perform bulk actions. Enjoy faster performance and developer-friendly tools like template placeholders and an improved code editor.

    🔬 Early Access

    Databricks Data Cloud Inbound
    Import bulk data from Databricks tables or views at near real-time speeds or at a scheduled time. After you import your data, transform and map it to Tealium attributes and build better audiences for targeted activation. Combine data storage with real-time data for cross-system connectivity to enable real-time, agile, consented data streams.

    Databricks outbound connector
    The Databricks connector empowers businesses to unify and activate their customer data with speed and intelligence. By seamlessly connecting Tealium’s real-time Customer Data Platform (CDP) with Databricks’ advanced AI and analytics capabilities, organizations can enrich customer profiles, enhance predictive modeling, and drive smarter, data-driven decisions.

    Audience sizing (sign up required*)
    Potential audience size shows how many visitor profiles—out of the total number of visitors—match your criteria in the audience creation and edit workflows. This helps you refine targeting and gain confidence in your audience conditions with a super quick calculation.

    New AudienceStream attributes experience (sign up required*)
    The AudienceStream attributes table has a cleaner, more organized experience—allowing you to quickly access details and take bulk actions like assigning labels or deleting attributes. Plus, a new Dependencies tab provides a clear summary of where each attribute is used, helping you manage dependencies with ease.

    *Early Access sign ups: If you are interested in trying this feature, contact your Tealium Support representative.

    June 30, 2025
    iQ Tag Management
    Consent integrations

    ✨ CookieConsent now supported in Tealium consent integrations

    We’ve added support for CookieConsent, a lightweight, open source consent management tool, in Tealium consent integrations. This replaces the legacy consent manager with the CookieConsent tool, which offers improved customization, integration, and transparency.

    With this new integration, you can:

    • Use a customizable, privacy-first banner to collect user consent.
    • Link category or service-level preferences to Tealium’s consent integrations.
    • Easily enforce consent decisions across your tags.
    • Capture and store decisions with the consent register.
    • Avoid third-party CMP subscription fees or vendor onboarding processes.

    This update is ideal for teams who want full control over design, behavior, and storage without relying on a commercial CMP.

    For more information, see CookieConsent consent integration.

    June 26, 2025
    iQ Tag Management
    Extensions

    New extensions for CookieConsent v3

    Two new extensions are now available in iQ Tag Management to support CookieConsent v3:

    • CookieConsent v3 Loader: Loads the CookieConsent library and applies your JSON configuration for layout, behavior, and categories.
    • CookieConsent v3 Logging: Sends user consent preferences to a specified endpoint for auditing or analytics.

    For more information, see CookieConsent v3 Loader and CookieConsent v3 Logging.

    June 18, 2025
    Platforms
    Tealium for iOS (Swift)

    Version 2.18.0

    Low Impact Changes

    • Fixed consent management logic for some edge cases:
      • Removed unintended grant_full_consent track events when consent was reset to an unknown state.
      • Fixed an issue with decline_consent events that could have been missed if that event was queued for other reason at that time (for example, if the connection was lost).
      • Fixed a bug where we would send grant_full_consent when the user gave consent, but consent categories were still nil. Now grant_full_consent is only sent if we have the list of categories and that list contains all of the categories. If the list is not present, or present but not full, we will send grant_partial_consent event instead.
    • Fixed a potential crash that could happen when refreshing a remote resource (such as remote settings or remote command JSON configuration) with no connectivity, while the Tealium instance was being deallocated.
    • Fixed a potential bug that could break the Equatable protocol and always return false for custom objects containing a dictionary of another non Objective-C Equatable object.
    June 17, 2025
    Server-side
    Connectors

    🚀 Experience the redesigned connectors UI

    We designed the connectors workflow from start to finish to give teams clearer performance insights, make repetitive tasks easier to manage, support advanced configuration with flexible editing tools, and ensure a consistent, accessible experience that scales with your business.

    The new connectors UI offers the following capabilities:

    ✨ Unified connector UI
    Manage both event data (EventStream) and visitor data (AudienceStream) connectors from a single, streamlined interface—no more switching between screens for different data types.

    ⚡ Copy mappings
    Save time by copying mapping configurations across connectors and actions. Reuse existing mappings with just a few clicks and simplify your setup process.

    ✏️ Enhanced template editor
    The new template editor features line numbers, syntax highlighting, autocomplete, and full-screen mode for a better coding experience.

    🔄 Flexible action selection
    Choose or change your action type at any stage in the workflow. Start without all the details and come back anytime to finish—work at your own pace and stay in control.

    📊 Improved metrics
    View comprehensive stats like total volume, success rates, and error counts at the connector level. Get quick insights for efficient monitoring and troubleshooting.

    For more information, see Connectors interface.

    April 9, 2025
    Platforms
    Tealium for HTTP API

    Upcoming change

    We are currently implementing validation of anonymous ID values in HTTP-API events. Invalid anonymous ID values will be rejected with the message Error 400, Bad Request: An invalid visitor ID '<invalid_string>' was supplied.

    At this stage, the release is not yet scheduled, and details may change based on testing results. We will provide an update after we have a confirmed release date.

    Expand to view list of invalid values

    The following strings and their corresponding SHA-256 hashes are considered invalid:

    • undefined
    • null
    • nan
    • unknown
    • []
    • {}
    • object
    • [object object]
    • 0
    • 1
    • true
    • false
    • yes
    • no
    • string
    • number
    • array
    • boolean
    • bigint
    • symbol
    • function
    • object
    • " " (space)
    • the SHA256 of empty string (""), but not the plain text value.

    CookieConsent & Tealium iQ
    CookieConsent is a flexible, open-source CMP integrated with client-side consent integrations, offering A/B testing, stronger enforcement, better accessibility, and a block-by-default framework. It also ensures accurate server-side tracking without duplication.

    New Connectors Experience
    The new connectors experience delivers streamlined workflows, improved connector metrics, enhanced error tracking, and upgraded usability such as the ability to copy mappings and perform bulk actions. Enjoy faster performance and developer-friendly tools like template placeholders and an improved code editor.

    Databricks Outbound Connector
    The Databricks Outbound Connector empowers businesses to unify and activate their customer data with speed and intelligence. By seamlessly connecting Tealium’s real-time Customer Data Platform (CDP) with Databricks’ advanced AI and analytics capabilities, organizations can enrich customer profiles, enhance predictive modeling, and drive smarter, data-driven decisions.

    EARLY ACCESS | SIGN-UP REQUIRED

    Early Access may only be available to select customers for the following programs. If you are interested in trying this feature, contact your Tealium Support representative.

    Audience Sizing
    Potential audience size shows how many visitor profiles—out of the total number of visitors—match your criteria in the audience creation and edit workflows. This helps you refine targeting and gain confidence in your audience conditions with a super quick calculation.

    New AudienceStream Attributes Experience
    The AudienceStream attributes table has a cleaner, more organized experience—allowing you to quickly access details and take bulk actions like assigning labels or deleting attributes. Plus, a new Dependencies tab provides a clear summary of where each attribute is used, helping you manage dependencies with ease.

    Concurrent Users in Server-Side Products
    Server-side concurrency helps organizations collaborate more easily in our server-side experience, allowing multiple users to work within Tealium without overriding or disrupting each other.

    Product highlights

    Tealium Product Highlights (February 2025)

    🔥 What’s New

    Consent Orchestration
    Server-side consent orchestration lets you centrally control consent conditions for event-level activations. It enforces user consent in real-time, ensuring that data processing aligns with user preferences and legal requirements.

    Custom Environment Publish Permissions
    We’re introducing enhanced controls to manage custom environments to better manage publishing access in Tealium iQ. This ensures only authorized users can deploy changes, providing better governance and preventing unintended updates in critical environments.

    New Tags and Connectors

    • Amazon S3 connector
    • Split.io connector
    • Sklik connector
    • Taboola Cookie Matching Service tag
    • Genesys Web Messaging tag

    ⏳ Coming Soon to GA

    Improved Server-Side Version History Experience
    The new server-side versions experience provides expanded visibility into component changes, merges, and publishes, providing a holistic historical record of saves and publishes.

    Tealium AI Assistant
    Powered with Tealium Docs, the Tealium AI Assistant is a chatbot that answers your questions about configuring and using Tealium.

    Cloud Data Warehouse Inbound (Snowflake)
    Import bulk data from Snowflake tables or views at near real-time speeds. After you import your data, transform and map it to Tealium attributes and build better audiences for targeted activation.

    🔬 Early Access Features

    Concurrent Users in Server-Side Products
    Server-side concurrency helps organizations collaborate more easily in our server-side experience, allowing multiple users to work without overriding or disrupting each other.

    CookieConsent & Tealium iQ
    CookieConsent is a flexible, open-source CMP integrated with consent integrations, offering A/B testing, stronger enforcement, better accessibility, and a block-by-default framework. It also ensures accurate server-side tracking without duplicates.

    Audience Sizing
    Potential size shows your total visitor population and how many profiles match your audience conditions in real time, helping you refine targeting.

    New Connectors Experience
    The new connectors experience delivers streamlined workflows, improved connector metrics, enhanced error tracking, and upgraded usability such as the ability to copy mappings and perform bulk actions. Enjoy faster performance and developer-friendly tools like template placeholders and an improved code editor.

    Cloud Data Warehouse Outbound (Databricks)
    The Tealium + Databricks integration empowers businesses to unify and activate their customer data with speed and intelligence. By seamlessly connecting the real-time Customer Data Platform (CDP) from Tealium with the advanced AI and analytics capabilities from Databricks, organizations can enrich customer profiles, enhance predictive modeling, and drive smarter, data-driven decisions.

    February 12, 2025
    Server-side
    Consent orchestration (Event-level)

    Tealium consent orchestration now Available

    We are excited to introduce Tealium consent orchestration, an event-level consent and data protection for server-side products which lets you centrally control consent conditions for event-level activations. This ensures that data processing aligns with user preferences and legal requirements.

    Consent orchestration offers the following capabilities:

    • Centralized Consent Management: Define and enforce consent rules on the server-side, organizing them into purpose groups to ensure compliance with user privacy policies.
    • Error Protection & Data Integrity: Prevent accidental data leaks by ensuring that data is activated only when consent is granted or valid exemption conditions are met.
    • Flexible Consent Policies: Customize and selectively apply consent policies at scale, ensuring that only consented data is processed while adapting to different regulatory requirements.
    • Exemptions: Define exemptions for specific conditions where data tracking is allowed without explicit user consent, providing flexibility while ensuring compliance with data protection regulations.
    • Controls event-level activations: Manage consent enforcement for EventStream connector actions, Event functions, EventStore, EventDB, and events processed by AudienceStream.

    For more information about consent orchestration, see the About consent orchestration.

    December 18, 2024
    Platforms
    Tealium Universal Tag (utag.js)

    Version 4.52

    For detailed information on the changes, how to implement them, and trade-offs, see Version 4.52+ notes.

    Version 4.52 introduces improved support for single-page applications (SPAs), optimizations for Google’s Interaction to Next Paint (INP) scores, improvements in session counting for first-party setups, and several bug fixes and performance updates.

    This release includes the following updates:

    • Queue for early tracking events
      Adds a queuing feature to make tracking functions (utag.view, utag.link and utag.track) immediately available on page load, eliminating issues (especially common in SPAs) when tracking calls are made before utag.js is loaded. Use this feature only with version 4.52 and later. Using it with earlier versions will prevent utag.js from running.
    • Non-blocking tags option
      A new setting, nonblocking_tags, improves Interaction to Next Paint (INP) scores by making tags non-blocking. This is useful for large or resource-intensive tags by reducing potential negative impacts on page load times and search rankings, but means that page interactions are no longer blocked by tags, which comes with tradeoffs. For more information on the tradeoffs, see Non-blocking tags option.
    • Fixed session counting for first-party setups
      Restores session counting for first-party and reverse-proxy customers, removing the need for custom solutions. First-party customers should deactivate any previous custom session counting configurations to avoid duplicate counting. For self-hosted setups, contact Tealium support to deactivate your billing requests.
    • Performance enhancements
      Optimizes performance by reducing unnecessary cookie reads and eliminating inconsistent behaviors:
      • Extensions scoped to Before Load Rules now execute once per page load. A new setting, suppress_before_load_rules_with_uids, has been added to restore legacy behavior, preventing Before Load Rules extensions from executing for tags loaded by UID.
      • Event attributes with the tealium_* prefix are now overwritten by Tealium-generated values, except for tealium_visitor_id and tealium_event. This prevents conflicts from manually set tealium_* attributes in the data layer.
    • Bug fixes:
      • Resolved an issue where specifying a non-existent tagUID in tracking calls could cause unexpected errors.
      • Added a fix for cases where consent integrations could ignore utag_cfg_ovrd settings initially (before respecting them ultimately) by populating utag.cfg before and after consent integrations.
    December 18, 2024

    April 10, 2024
    Administration

    Updates and fixes

    Tealium’s infrastructure is being expanded to maintain seamless operations with increased server-side traffic. We are adding IP addresses to all of our data processing regions.

    If you are using allowlists (also known as safelists or whitelists), include the new IP addresses to continue operating without increased error rates.

    The additional IP addresses will be introduced on the following dates:

    • Apr 29, 2024 - US (Oregon)
    • May 6, 2024 - EU (Ireland and Frankfurt)
    • May 13, 2024 - APJ (Hong Kong, Sydney, Tokyo)
    • May 20, 2024 - US (US East 1)

    If the new IP addresses are not added to your current allowlist before the roll-out date, you may notice increased connector errors, function action errors, and files not being read from non-S3 file services.

    For a full list of IP addresses to allow and how to test your configuration for any issues after the change, see Tealium IP addresses to allow.

    January 31, 2024
    Server-side connectors

    Updates and fixes

    • Updated the Algolia Insights connector by adding new Object Data configuration fields to fix a problem when mapping the product_position_number parameter to Positions.
    • Updated the Amazon Ads Audience Management connector with the following changes:
      • Added EventStream support.
      • Deprecated the /amc/partner/instances endpoint and migrate to /amc/instances.
    • Updated the Amazon Ads Conversions connector to support additional user match keys.
    • Updated the Amazon Advertising DSP connector to support country code for audience creation.
    • Updated the Firebase Cloud Messaging connector to correct an issue with template rendering.
    • Updated the LinkedIn Conversions connector to fix an error with sending the email parameter. When sending any additional user information, such as company, title, or country code, the user first name and last name are required, even if an email or UUID is provided.
    • Updated the Reddit Conversions connector to remove transaction_id and add conversion_id and product parameters to the Conversion Event mapping section.
    • Updated the Google Analytics 4 Measurement Protocol connector to remove character limits for page_title, page_location, and page_referrer and support user-provided data and consent states.
    • Updated the Yandex Metrica connector with the following changes:
      • Configuration: The Counter ID value is now a part of the connector configuration.
      • The Yandex Client ID (_ym_uid) is mappable and now a required parameter.
      • The Products parameter is now two arrays, an array that represents the product IDs (key) and another that represents quantities of each product (value).
      • Send Order Event: Now requires a date type attribute.
      • Send Ecommerce Event: The Currency code is now mappable and the Action Field is now Purchase Fields and is no longer required.
      • Upsert Contact Event: clientID is no longer accepted. To pass Client IDs, use client_ids.

    January 1, 2024
    Platforms
    Tealium for iOS (Swift)

    Version 2.11.0

    Medium Impact Changes

    • Increased minimum supported operating system versions: iOS 11.0, TvOS 11.0, WatchOS 4.0, and MacOS 10.13.
    • Changed the storage default directory on disk for TvOS from Application Support to Caches because Application Support was not supported on the TVs.
    • Removed the iAd framework from the Attribution module because it was disabled by Apple and will be removed soon.

    Low Impact Changes

    • Implemented the option to disable the whole SDK from remote settings.
    • Updated the list of device names, including Mac devices and the newest iOS devices.
    • Fixed TealiumVisitorProfile parsing to gracefully accept null strings.
    • Improved error logs readability.
    • Updated list of iOS device models.

    Known Issues

    • This is our final release targeting XCode 14. Note that XCode 15 dropped support for iOS 11. To install on XCode 15, you must manually increase the minimum deployment target of the Tealium library to iOS 12 after installing it or the app will crash on launch. For more information, see TEALIUM SWIFT BUG: Runtime crash on launch with Xcode 15 Release.

    September 1, 2023
    Platforms
    Tealium Universal Tag (utag.js)

    Version 4.50

    For more information see Version 4.50+ notes.

    Version 4.50 provides more transparency and control over cookies written by utag.js.

    Previously, we recommended using multi-value cookies (multicookies). However, due to the increasing demand for transparency and simplicity, particularly for data privacy audits, we have revised our recommendation. Now, we advise using standalone cookies, which is now the default behavior in utag.js.

    This release includes the following updates:

    • Writes separate utag_main cookies instead of a single multi-value cookie. To use the legacy behavior that stores multiple values in a single cookie, set split_cookie to false.
    • Moves responsibility for utag_main_v_id from utag.js to the Tealium Collect tag. To force utag.js to set the utag_main_v_id cookie, set always_set_v_id to true.
    • Adds a new id element in the consent manager cookie for logging consent. When this cookie is first set, it will match any utag_main_v_id values found, after which it won’t be changed. That behavior prioritizes maintaining the link between the user and the logged events, but means that a match isn’t guaranteed in all cases.
    • Can easily be upgraded by updating the relevant templates.
    • Adds the following utag settings:
      • split_cookie - Set to false to use the legacy single multi-value cookie.
      • split_cookie_allowlist - Specifies an array cookie names that can be set using the utag_main namespace.
      • always_set_v_id - Forces utag.js to set the utag_main_v_id cookie or the v_id component of utag_main.
    • Updates the following templates:
      • utag.js (loader) to version 4.50, to update cookie behavior
      • cmGeneral to version 3.0.12, to add centralized logic for generating or retrieving a device ID that can be called from consent logging templates
      • cmDoNotSell to version 1.4.0, to call the centralized logic
      • fullConsentEventHandler to version 1.0.3, to call the centralized logic
      • partialConsentEventHandler to version 1.0.3, to call the centralized logic
      • Collect to version tv:20064.20230519 (released in May 2023)

    For more information about the new settings for enhanced transparency in utag 4.50 or later, see Enhancing Cookie Transparency with utag 4.51.

    March 2023

    iQ Tag Management
    Consent integrations

    New/Cool Stuff

    • Consent Integrations Launch
      Tealium is excited to introduce client-side consent integrations, a new consent enforcement framework to enforce end-user consent decisions captured by non-Tealium consent management platforms (CMPs). Consent integrations offers the following capabilities:

      • A flexible consent enforcement framework to ensure consent preferences are managed properly.
      • Each consent integration provides the option for both opt-in (GDPR-style) and opt-out (CCPA-style) enforcement patterns, ensuring compliance with critical data privacy regulations.
      • Integrations are available for Didomi, OneTrust, and Usercentrics, with an integration that respects any opt-out cookie or the Global Privacy Control (GPC) signal.
      • Supports custom integration development with other CMPs.

      For more information about consent integrations, see the About consent integrations.

    March 1, 2023
    iQ Tag Management
    Client-side consent management

    Updates

    • Renamed legacy consent management tools to remove specific regulation names
      Updated the name of consent management components to remove references to specific regulations and remove GDPR Rule Creator. There are no changes in behavior.
    • Added new Consent logging templates to Template Status Checker
      Added support for the new consent logging templates fullConsentEventHandler and partialConsentEventHandler to Tealium iQ’s Template Status Checker.
    • Updated partialConsentEventHandler and fullConsentEventHandler templates to version 1.0.2
      Updated partialConsentEventHandler and fullConsentEventHandler templates to version 1.0.2. This fixes an issue where consent logging payloads could include the wrong cookie value as the trace_id if a cookie name included the string “trace_id”.
    • Updated Tealium GPC support to be more conservative and compliant out-of-the-box
      The opt-out logic related to Global Privacy Control (GPC) in the cmDoNotSell template has been updated to be more conservative out-of-the-box. Previously, when a user’s consent cookie explicitly allowed tracking but the GPC signal indicated an opt-out, the GPC opt-out signal was ignored in favor of the cookie. As of version 1.2.0 of cmDoNotSell, the GPC opt-out signal is always respected, even if there is a cookie indicating that the user agrees to the sale or sharing of their data.
    March 1, 2023

    iQ Tag Management
    Client-side consent management

    Updates and fixes

    • Updated cmGeneral template to version 3.0.11
      Updated cmGeneral template to version 3.0.11. This update fixes an issue introduced in version 3.0.10 where sometimes null is included in the consent_categories array instead of the expected category key when categories have been deactivated.
    • Updated fullConsentEventHander and partialConsentEventHandler consent logging templates
      The fullConsentEventHander and partialConsentEventHandler consent logging templates have been updated with the following:
      • Include the value of the trace_id cookie as cp.trace_id in the logging request, if present.
      • Use an array of consent categories instead of a comma-separated string.
        These changes are included in a new template version, which gives you the flexibility to decide if and when to upgrade and tailor the requirements to your specific needs.
    • Fixed an issue where the Edge browser was incorrectly recognized as Chrome in the Active browser type and Active browser version preloaded attributes. This bug will be fixed with the first publish of each CDH profile after this release. This is because the preloaded logic is part of the configuration of each CDH profile.

    October 1, 2022
    Server-side
    Server-side consent management

    Fixes

    • Exposed the Global Privacy Control header (Sec-GPC) as global_privacy_control_opt_out in incoming event payloads.
      • No event-level attribute is automatically added.
      • Possible values are true, (Sec-GPC: 1), false (Sec-GPC:0) or unassigned (if there is no header).
      • For more information about GPC and how to respect the GPC signal with Tealium, see About Global Privacy Control.
    • Removed consent-based filtering of Tealium consent change events in EventStream.
      • These events can now be streamed to any consent logging destination.
      • There are no changes to consent-related filtering of other events or AudienceStream behavior.

    Version 1.5.0

    • Visitor Switching
      • Added TealiumConfig.visitorIdentityKey to specify the data layer key that represents a known identity in the data layer
      • Known identities are hashed and linked to the tealium_visitor_id for better switching between known identities
    • Added the following listeners:
      • VisitorIdUpdatedListener: notifies when the visitor ID is updated as a result of switching identities or resetting the visitor ID
      • DataLayerUpdatedListener: listens for updates to key-value pairs in the data layer
      • onDataUpdated(String, Any): notifies when a value is updated in the data layer
      • onDataRemoved(Set<String>): notifies when the specified key is removed from the data layer by user interaction or data expiration

    November 1, 2021
    Platforms
    Tealium for iOS (Swift)

    Version 2.5.0

    High Impact Changes

    • The AutoTracking module now supports SwiftUI and UIKit and is cross-platform (iOS, watchOS, tvOS, and macOS).

    Medium Impact Changes

    • Added SPM support for AutoTracking module.
    • Added automatic handling of deep links for SceneDelegate and SwiftUI apps.
    • Added an info.plist flag TealiumAutotrackingDeepLinkEnabled with the value of false to disable automatic deep link tracking.
    • Added support for manual tracking of deep links:
      • SwiftUI: use trackingAppOpenUrl() View modifier or TealiumAppTrackable container View.
      • UIKit: use handleDeepLink() from your AppDelegate or SceneDelegate.

    Low Impact Changes

    • Made all data layer and Collector’s variables available using the method Tealium.gatherTrackData().
    • Renamed TealiumKeys to TealiumDataKeys, for use with gatherTrackData().
    • Improved Codable support by ignoring non-codable values in release builds and causing a crash in debug builds.
    • Reduced Geofences loading usage of main thread.

    Known Issues

    • CocoaPods platform iOS version is increased to 11 due to linting issues (but, if required, it’s safe to lower it to 9 with a post-install script).
    • Carthage generates warnings with Xcode 13 (https://github.com/Carthage/Carthage/issues/3238).

    April 2021

    Platforms
    Tealium for Android (Kotlin)

    Version 1.2.4

    • Core 1.2.4

      • Added new data layer variables enabled_modules and enabled_modules_versions. Both are arrays of strings, containing a sorted list of modules in use and their version number - latest versions of all modules required to retrieve their version.

      module names have also been changed from UPPER_SNAKE_CASE to PascalCase to match Swift.

      • New config option remoteApiEnabled to permit disabling of remote_api events when using the RemoteCommands and TagManagement modules.
      • New config option overrideCollectProfile to permit overriding the value of tealium_profile in the event payload, routing events to a different Tealium profile to the one set on the TealiumConfig object.
      • Bug fix: Added support for both application/json and x-www-form-urlencoded content types when using the HttpRemoteCommand.
      • Bug fix: Fixed an issue with specific collections not being encoded correctly.
    April 1, 2021
    Platforms
    Tealium for iOS (Swift)

    Version 2.3.0

    High Impact Changes

    • Added the option to set a WKProcessPool instance on the TealiumConfig object for the Tealium Tag Management webview to use to avoid cookie synchronization issues.
    • Removed the data layer value call_type and replaced it with tealium_event_type. When the event type is a standard track and not a screen view, the tealium_event_type value is now event instead of link.

    If your load rules or attribute rules are configured to look for call_type, update them to look for tealium_event_type instead. If they were checking for the value link on event types, update the condition to check for event.

    Low Impact Changes

    • Minor fix to resolve a small memory leak in the RemoteCommands module.
    • Minor fix in the lifecycle module that was sending the lifecycle_diddetectcrash=true on sleep and wake events.
    • Custom consent policies are now supported.

    Platforms
    Tealium for iOS (Objective C)

    Version 5.8.0

    Medium Impact Changes

    • Lower-cased the value of the platform variable to correct mobile session timer. Previously, sessions were measured similarly to web (30 minutes of consistent activity). By lower-casing the platform variable, the Customer Data Hub recognizes the incoming data as a mobile session and the session length is shortened to 2 minutes.

    Update your load rules if you have Load or Attribute Rules configured checking for case sensitive platform values such as iOS vs ios.

    Low Impact Changes

    • Resolved build warnings and updated deprecated APIs

    Platforms
    Tealium for iOS (Objective C)

    Version 5.7.0

    High Impact Changes

    • Added support for native session counting in lieu of using the session counting logic within utag.js. This provides more accurate session counts, and fixes some edge cases where background activities triggered new sessions, resulting in higher than expected session counts.

    ⚠️ Important ⚠️ If Tag Management is enabled in the Mobile Publish Settings, you must also update the mobile.html template within the associated account. If this action isn’t performed, duplicate sessions are recorded in Tealium. Read more about how to update a template.

    July 1, 2020
    Platforms
    Tealium for iOS (Swift)

    Version 2.0.0

    New Features

    • New CCPA API added to the consent manager module. Learn more in the consent manager documentation.
    • Native Hosted Data Layer support
    • Automatic Deep Link tracking that will add deeplink URLs, universal link URLs, and query string parameters to the data layer when the user opens the app from one of these methods.
    • Ability to start a Trace by scanning a QR Code from the Customer Data Hub UI
    • Added a new TealiumLogger that uses the Apple preferred OSLog vs the print function. There is still an option to use print by setting the logType property on the TealiumConfig object. Read more about Logging.
    • Combined several ancillary modules into the Core library for faster and more straightforward installation. See the modules section for more information.
    • Updated the track() method to accept a Dispatch type of View or Event. This allows us to support one track method and provide more clarity around screen and event tracking. Read more about the updated track() method.
    • Support for more expiration options for data variables. See Data layer for more information.
    • Support for native session counting in lieu of using the session counting logic within utag.js. This provides more accurate session counts, and fixes some edge cases where background activities triggered new sessions, resulting in higher than expected session counts.

    ⚠️Important⚠️ If the Tag Management Module is being used as the dispatch option, you must also update the mobile.html template within the associated TiQ account/profile. If this action isn’t performed, duplicate sessions are recorded in Tealium. Learn more about how to update a template or contact your Account Manager for assistance.

    High Impact Changes

    • Updated the API to be more in line with Swift best practices
    • Optimized the modules system for better performance
    • Optimized the individual modules for better performance
    • Removed multiple delegate options for API simplicity
    • Improved connectivity checks - NWPathMonitor now used on supported devices
    • Removed the CrashReporter module from the project and added to a separate repository for those that want to use it
    • Removed NotificationCenter in the RemoteCommands module and replaced it with the Delegate pattern

    Low Impact Changes

    • Added more protocols and result types for testability
    • Updated class names for consistency with other Tealium libraries
    • Added more inline code documentation
    • Updated unit tests and added performance testing

    For previous release notes prior to 2.x, see Tealium for Swift 1.x.

    October 2019

    Platforms
    Tealium for iOS (Objective C)

    Version 5.6.0

    High Impact Changes

    • Removed the UIWebView entirely to now only support WKWebView as Apple has deprecated UIWebView since iOS 8.0. We kept the support for the UIWebView for convenience, and to ensure visitor sessions and analytics history was left intact. However, per ITMS-90809: Deprecated API Usage - Apple will stop accepting submissions of apps that use UIWebView APIs. Learn more about UIWebView. We do have the WKHTTPCookieStore in place that will migrate the cookies used in UIWebView over to the WKWebView. This will ensure that the user IDs/visitor cookies will seamlessly transition to the new implementation.

    Medium Impact Changes

    • Updated the device list to include the latest Apple devices (X, XR, XS, 11, etc). We also updated the implementation to load from a JSON file instead of hardcoding the device names. Lastly, we added two more variables with extra device detail: model_name (such as iPhone 8, iPhone XR Max, iPhone 11 Pro, etc) and model_variant" For example, "GSM", "WiFi", "model A1457, A1518, A1528", etc. If no extra model information is available, the standard device variable will read something like: "iPhone 10,0".

    July 13, 2018

    June 2018

    Platforms
    Tealium Universal Tag (utag.js)

    Version 4.46

    • Adds support for the following new built-in variables:
      • tealium_session_number - a duplicate of the existing value in utag.data['cp.utag_main__sn']
      • tealium_session_event_number - the cookie value in utag.data['cp.utag_main__se'] that counts the number of tracking calls (utag.view(), utag.link()) in the current session (visit). This is useful for Single Page Apps (SPAs) where there is only one page load with many tracked events on that page. For pages using the noview flag, the value is ‘1’ for both page load (load rule evaluation) and the first call to utag.view().
    • Adds support for an empty param list passed into utag.link, utag.view or utag.track calls. In previous versions, calls to utag.link() or utag.view() work fine, but gets an extra cfg object added to the data layer. Calls to utag.track() causes an exception in previous versions.
    • For pages using noview flag, there are two things to keep in mind:
      • The data layer will have a ‘1’ value for tealium_session_event_number for both page load (utag.js uses data layer to loads in tags) and first call to utag.view (which fires tags and/or loads in more tags.)
      • Because cookies are used and initialized at page load time, if the utag.view call does not happen in time on the first page, and the page is refreshed in browser, it moves to ‘2’ for the first utag.view call which happens on second page. This is an edge case since most implementations calls utag.view immediately after utag.js executes.
    • This update also includes fixes for the “OU” function used by legacy Privacy Manager Extension.
      • The OPTOUTMULTI cookie is re-checked with each call to utag.view/link (no page refresh required)
      • Tags fired directly by tag’s UID also checks the OPTOUTMULTI cookie settings before firing

    August 2016

    Platforms
    Tealium Universal Tag (utag.js)

    Version 4.42

    Added built-in Tealium event attributes. These attributes are added to each Tealium view or link event.

    • tealium_visitor_id The Tealium-generated ID in the cookie cp.utag_main_v_id
    • tealium_session_id The epoch timestamp string of current session start in ms
    • tealium_account The account string value in the path to the utag.js file
    • tealium_profile The profile string value in the path to the utag.js file
    • tealium_environment The environment string value in the path to the utag.js file. For example, “dev” or “prod.”
    • tealium_datasource The data source key from Tealium EventStream.
    • tealium_random A random number as a string for use in cache busting
    • tealium_library_name The name of the library (utag.js)
    • tealium_library_version The version of the utag.js. For example, “4.42.0” for this release)
    • tealium_timestamp_epoch Current epoch time in seconds as an integer
    • tealium_timestamp_utc Current ISO string timestamp for UTC time zone (not available on older browsers)
    • tealium_timestamp_local Current ISO string timestamp for browser’s time zone (not available on older browsers)

    August 1, 2016

    April 2016

    Platforms
    Tealium Universal Tag (utag.js)

    Version 4.40

    Improvements in behavior in Single Page App (SPA) sites using utag.link and utag.view

    Previously, items in current data layer passed to utag.link/view were merged into the utag.data global object. This was required to re-evaluate load rules for each utag.link/view call. The utag.js 4.40 template takes advantage of a publish engine update so that this is no longer required. In version 4.40, the utag.data global object is not updated with each utag.link or utag.view call.

    You may use the following JS Extension to test for backwards compatibility with 4.39 behavior before updating to 4.40.

    // JS Extension scoped to "Before Load Rules"
utag.ut.merge( b, utag.data, 0 );
utag.ut.merge( utag.data, b ,1 );

    New “noconsole” flag.

    Setting the flag in utag_cfg_ovrd object to true stops any output from utag.DB from displaying in the web console. If debugging is enabled, the output still persist in the utag.db_log array.

    Creating an iframe in DOM using utag.ut.loader function

    If an iframe with the same ID already exists, the iframe is not added again. Instead, the iframe src is updated.

    Updating JS Page vars value for utag.view or utag.link calls

    JS Page vars are now updated to their current value with every call to utag.view or utag.link. As a result the b["js_page.my_global_var"] has the latest value in window.my_global_var each time utag.link is called.

    Bug fix to keep cp.utag_main_ses_id in the data layer with every utag.link or utag.view call

    The value is now updated with a new session ID following a utag.link/view call that occurs when the visitor has been on the same page for 30 minutes with no activity.

    Removed trick to use eval to read the document.referrer value into the data layer’s b["dom.referrer"]

    New utag.ut.encode function

    This function falls back to use escape when encodeURIComponent issues an exception (an exception is possible when attempting to encode Unicode characters that are incomplete or incorrectly formed).

    _t_visitor_id and _t_session_id are no longer available

    Auto-generated data layer values _t_visitor_id and _t_session_id are no longer available. These are replaced by ut.visitor_id and ut.session_id. If you still need these values, add them back in as follows:

    // JS Extension scoped to "Before Load Rules"
b["_t_visitor_id"] = b["cp.utag_main_v_id"];
b["_t_session_id"] = b["cp.utag_main_ses_id"];

    October 2014

    Platforms
    Tealium Universal Tag (utag.js)

    Version 4.34

    • Added an override (utag_cfg_ovrd) flag to utag.js to delay the loading of Tags until the DOM readyState “complete” (AKA “load”) event. This flag provides a delay that may improve page display time speeds by causing all Tags with the Wait = Yes setting to execute even later. Set this flag by entering the following code into a PreLoader-scoped JavaScript Code extension:
    var utag_cfg_ovrd = {};
utag_cfg_ovrd.dom_complete = true;
    • Fixed a bug for the Internet Explorer browser in which the DOM readyState was reported as “interactive” prematurely. An extra delay for readyState “complete” was added for older of Internet Explorer.
    October 1, 2014

    September 2014

    Platforms
    Tealium Universal Tag (utag.js)

    Version 4.33

    • Added two new DOM Variables (formerly Data Sources): browser height (dom.viewport_height) and browser width (dom.viewport_width). Use these in Load Rules to detect when a visitor is using a certain devices to browse your site. For example, when this value is less than 480, you might assume the visitor is using a phone device. Try this on your phone for fun.
    • Added support for custom attributes on iframes/scripts to the utag.ut.loader function.

    September 1, 2014

    August 2014

    Platforms
    Tealium Universal Tag (utag.js)

    Version 4.32

    • Fixed a bug with Publish Settings so that you may now enable both the Ready Wait Flag and Bundling Libs publish settings for the same profile.
    • Fixed a bug in which enabling the Ready Wait Flag setting caused the utag.cfg.noview flag to reset to false if you had set it to true.
    • Introducing the new configuration flag, Wait Timer (utag_cfg_ovrd.waittimer). Tags do not load until the DOM Ready signal. With this flag set exactly how long after the DOM Ready signal the tags wait before they load. Setting this flag exposes the load time of a webpage without including the load times of third-party vendor Tags. Set this value in milliseconds.

    Here is an example of how to set the Wait Timer flag:

    var utag_cfg_ovrd={};
utag_cfg_ovrd.waittimer=3000;

    This delays the loading of all tags until 3 seconds after the DOM Ready signal.

    April 1, 2014

    February 2014

    Platforms
    Tealium Universal Tag (utag.js)

    Version 4.27

    • Introduces support for AudienceStream Data Layer Enrichment. This requires AudienceStream and the DataCloud Tag.
    • The utag.js reads Meta tags with every utag.view call to capture dynamic Meta tags.
    • There are several changes to the utag_main cookie:

      • The utag_main cookie’s lifespan is now set to 1 year to conform to EU laws.

      • The session ID (ses_id) value in the utag_main cookie is now a timestamp that is used to compute a visitor’s time on your website.

        To reference this value, use the following syntax:

        b["cp.utag_main_ses_id"]

      • Introduces the session number value in the utag_main cookie.

        To reference this value, use the following syntax:

        b["cp.utag_main__sn"]

      • Introduces the page number value, which increments every time utag.js loads, essentially with each new URL load. This is not to be confused with an Event Counter. This value starts over at 1 with each new session.

        To reference this value, use the following syntax:

        b["cp.utag_main__pn"]

      • Known issue: The page number (_pn) and session number (_sn) values are set to NaN whenever a visitor visits a website in which the utag_main session cookies was already set by a version of utag.js prior to 4.27. This issue is resolved in utag.js version 4.28.

    • Introduces the utag.ut.flatten function, which flattens objects. This is primarily used with Data Layer Enrichment for AudienceStream.
    February 1, 2014

    January 2014

    Platforms
    Tealium Universal Tag (utag.js)

    Version 4.26

    Many significant changes and enhancements.

    For more information see Version 4.26 notes.

    January 1, 2014

    November 2013

    Platforms
    Tealium Universal Tag (utag.js)

    Version 4.011

    Adding support for Server to Server. There is now a Server to Server advanced setting that enables a tag to send data directly from Tealium to the vendor.

    November 15, 2013
    Platforms
    Tealium Universal Tag (utag.js)

    Version 4.010

    Fixes a bug when using the Tealium Currency Converter tag or any Tag with a value set for Custom Source Advanced setting, in which the Tag waits until for a force timeout threshold of 3 seconds or greater to call the u.send function for the other Tags.

    November 1, 2013

    September 2013

    Platforms
    Tealium Universal Tag (utag.js)

    Version 4.009

    Fixes a bug in which “Wait = Yes” tags wait for a “load” event instead of DOM Ready event when utag.js was executed after DOM Ready.

    For many sites, this is a significant performance boost and loads tags that are set to wait for DOM Ready much sooner.

    September 1, 2013

    March 2013

    Platforms
    Tealium Universal Tag (utag.js)

    Version 4.008

    Update to support domains ending in “.edu.au” and “.net.au” (using “au” for an example.) The previous utag.js only supported “.com.au” and “.org.au”

    Update to utag.loader.GV (the internal “Get Variables in Object” function) to use hasOwnProperty. This is the safer way to iterate.

    March 1, 2013

    January 2013

    Platforms
    Tealium Universal Tag (utag.js)

    Version 4.007

    Fixes an issue in which the customer may see an exception in the “pre” function by entering something like myobj.utag_data for the “Page Data Object” Publish Setting (assuming the myobj doesn’t exist). This exception caused pieces of code to get skipped and resulted in checking .length for a utag.handler.extend variable that was never defined. There is now a check to see if utag.handler.extend is defined.

    January 15, 2013
    Platforms
    Tealium Universal Tag (utag.js)

    Version 4.006

    The Publish Engine builds a utag.loader.cfgsort variable that is an Array of the Tag UIDs. This Array is in the right order of the Tags in Tealium iQ. Tags now fire in the order that matches the Tealium iQ’s order.

    January 1, 2013

    December 2012

    Platforms
    Tealium Universal Tag (utag.js)

    Version 4.005

    Adds the utility function utag.ut.decode.

    Also adds support for a “no cookie” flag utag.cfg.nocookie. When the utag.cfg.nocookie value is defined and set to true then utag.js does not write any utag_main cookies.

    Existing utag_main cookies are not modified or removed. Some tags expect that utag_main cookies exist, so use this flag at your own risk.

    Sample (Pre Loader-scoped JavaScript Code Extension):

    var utag_cfg_ovrd={};  
utag_cfg_ovrd.nocookie=true;

    utag.ut.decode is a safer version of decodeURIComponent (if decodeURIComponent issues an exception, then unescape is used)

    December 1, 2012

    November 2012

    Platforms
    Tealium Universal Tag (utag.js)

    Version 4.004

    Includes a fix for an Internet Explorer DOM Ready Extension “timing” issue in Internet Explorer 7 and Internet Explorer 8 in which Internet Explorer may or may not run the DOM Ready Extensions before Tags are loaded. This version fixes the issue to ensure that DOM Ready Extensions run first. This provides consistent behavior in all browsers.

    Changes in utag.DB. This function is changed so that every utag.DB call does not “re-check” the cookie for utagdb=true; this makes for a high-performance utag.DB function.

    Adds additional utag.DB calls in utag.js.

    How do you turn on debugging? Run this in a console: document.cookie="utagdb=true"

    Sample utag.DB call:

    utag.DB("Inside of DOM Ready Extension");
    November 1, 2012

    October 2012

    Platforms
    Tealium Universal Tag (utag.js)

    Version 4.003

    Adds the ability to set a utag_main cookie to expire at a specific timestamp.

    utag.loader.SC("utag_main",{"mycookie123":"testing123;exp-1351111959896u"});

    Note the u at the end of the timestamp

    October 1, 2012

    August 2012

    Platforms
    Tealium Universal Tag (utag.js)

    Version 4.002

    Runs through the utag.link also for each of the sub profile tags.

    August 15, 2012
    Platforms
    Tealium Universal Tag (utag.js)

    Version 4.001

    Fixes a cookie decode issue in which the cookie had strange characters.

    August 1, 2012
